main event: On 7 April 1949, an amber cylindrical-shaped object was sighted in Charlotte, North Carolina, during a rodeo event at Memorial Stadium.
interesting points: The object was observed to be stationary,Observers reported that the object emitted a steady, constant amber light.,Some witnesses initially confused the observed light with stadium lighting or aircraft lights.,A Pyrex insulator was identified later as a cause of the strange appearance of the object.,Despite multiple interviews with local authorities and astronomers, no other unusual phenomena were reported on the same night.
witness description: The observers included a mix of local residents, a farmer, and a postal employee, all describing similar sightings at the same time.
